message_1: A message "HELLO" is encrypted using a Vigenere cipher with the key "MATH". What is the resulting ciphertext? (Assume we are working with the English alphabet and letters are represented by their corresponding numerical positions, i.e. A = 0, B = 1, C = 2, and so on.)
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using a Vigenere cipher with the key "MATH", we first need to repeat the key to match the length of the message. In this case, the key becomes "MATHM".

Now, we will add the numerical positions of the corresponding letters in the message and the key, and then take the result modulo 26 to get the encrypted letter.

Message:  H   E   L   L   O
Position: 7   4  11  11  14

Key:      M   A   T   H   M
Position: 12  0  19   7  12

Add the positions:

(7+12) % 26 = 19  ->  T
(4+0) % 26 = 4   ->  E
(11+19) % 26 = 4 ->  E
(11+7) % 26 = 18  ->  S
(14+12) % 26 = 0  ->  A

The resulting ciphertext is "TEESA".
